topic.title: Community on ZeroNet
topic.body:
So I know there is Kaffeine to search, and 0List to find other places - but is ZeroTalk the main hub for discussion on the ZeroNet? I want to leave Reddit and find a replacement community, and I see a lot of potential in ZeroNet - but I don't like that discussion is all in one place, so you get Nazis, Racists, and Pedos all in the same place as Mac vs Linux and discussions about integrating ZeroNet and Electron, etc.

Is there a zite that has a decent community, for tech and other interesting discussions? I have seen the 0chan and the Reddit clone, but I want to avoid pr0n and the Reddit clone doesn't seem to have users (and I don't want to have to have a separate login to use it, part of why I am here).

topic.title: Zite for ZeroNet Devs
topic.body: I have made a few pull requests for ZeroTalk, and would like to discuss the architecture and learn about developing with ZeroNet more - is there a zite I can visit to talk to other ZeroNet devs?

2_18eGWSaM3Vc9i61LVfogjQJf5gp7EN7b9Y.body:
> [styromaniac](#comment_29_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): The bill passed this morning. :(

Do you have a link or source for that?

2_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj.body: Why is this stickied? And who is able to sticky posts?

1_1FxpcMsoTKTeUoNDRJKzqyLAwXuwVg3zgX.body: I made an issue for this: https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/871

> [vexi](#comment_1_1CWuwt8TTz4Daj3okhWD5jRVCRDeN6gRdm): Does it realy matter? I welcome our chinese comrads :)

Eh, I really just want an alternative to ZeroTalk that lots of ZeroNet people use, but lets you filter based on the content - like a traditional chan board, or like Reddit's setup with subreddits. It seems the Language is what defines the different boards here, so I am wishing I didn't have to sift through Chinese comments to find content I can understand. It's not personal. :-D

> [4tee2](#comment_1_1Lr88ePoU9FsXzkUPsENX5xLcei8jtxeTM): All a bit random yeah. I also enjoy throwing darts in a coal cellar at midnight when the electricty goes out...but not all the time.

You have that down to an art! Do the Chinese have their own language board?

> [givemepsy](#comment_10_16UbJDyboDaAjW5fiZouKWpPJztpt43kEj): i am Chinese and i use English here

I don't mind the Chinese writing English here, I only mind when whole threads are only in Chinese (which I can't understand). There is a Chinese forum that should be used for those posts instead.

1_19Z8aJ32x4pE2iGvVssPJazJgpGe5L32rq.body: Not exactly eloquent, but it would be nice if I didn't have to see such hate...

12_1KdnTJVBGzEZrJppFZtzfG9chukuMv8xSb.body:
> [bot](#comment_171_1KdnTJVBGzEZrJppFZtzfG9chukuMv8xSb): 
> Can't say. I lost my Ubuntu laptop in fire just over a year ago.

:-0 You can ask others to compile for you. Linux support is 100% a requirement (for me at least).

1_1H1GKxHTUrNaP34cFdgAfTUJ8tpktSXAu2.body:
> [tiamat](#comment_1_1MaKJotNGHhDQh1BnZCEBqU5Gwj88gFLyR): use this: https://es.wordpress.org/plugins/simply-static/

Kinda weird work-around, for the average user - but it's doable for those that *really* want it.

3_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd.body:
> [twiggy](#comment_55_1BRSETd8x5XUtHt9jz2e4WdB9rWY1WNfiu): I know another reason why people should stop using Chrome -- Vault 7

Well...

> The files, dated from 2013–2016, include details on the agency's software capabilities, such as the ability to compromise smart TVs,[1] web browsers (including Firefox, Google Chrome, and Microsoft Edge), and the operating systems of most smartphones (including Apple's iOS and Google's Android), as well as other operating systems such as Microsoft Windows, macOS, and Linux.

- [Vault 7 Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vault_7) 

Firefox is included, as is Linux.

1_1Mr36Z4TSbWQ236NfvRPeLn3qsAwngBzMd.body:
> [ajeremias](#comment_1_16vTpf45GU9hetTnSdFMkfEjdoin2DnZxB): awesome.. mute works! ^^

Yep, should go a long way for getting rid of shitty content. Would be better to create another zite that is like ZeroTalk that is based around boards for a given topic, so that users aren't all in the same pool. For now, ZeroNet is small enough it's fine to just mute the less than savory users.

6_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd.body:
> [hexkey](#comment_30_18NsJqjikBYBjwLzMVp7aBJSpqtyRSd9qF): yo we got ya covered fam

Fuck yeah!

2_14nCEDo97Cx4VpSHwPytWvacPo29Y7FAbk.body:
> [p2p](#comment_291_13Z7XxTa7JuFat3KzzMWu3onwM6biLuurJ): just post here--ZeroTalk

Well, for example - how do I get changes I have made to local `.coffee` files like `TopicList.coffee` from my fork of the [ZeroTalk repo](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroTalk) to take effect on my ZeroNet? I mean, what's the build and deployment process look like?

I see that there is an `all.js` file - I suppose I need to build that somehow from the `coffee` files, and then maybe use a proxy to map a request for `all.js` with my local version instead? I don't know - I just need some help getting into this.

> [bot](#comment_180_1KdnTJVBGzEZrJppFZtzfG9chukuMv8xSb): Devs can't work on restricted KB so ZT is not suited.
> 
> Yes, when you siteSign in --debug mode (only in debug mode) it compiles all .coffee and .js files into all.jsFor testing you'll have to right-click reload frame then reload page to get the new all.js version loaded.Another way is to increment the name like 'all-1.js' and same for index.html to load it.If you suspect it's not reloading then that's a good way to make certain.

I am not sure what you mean by "siteSign" - is there documentation I can read, or something more about `--debug` mode? I have the ZeroNet and ZeroTalk repos both in separate locations - I don't really understand how they are connected, as far as builds and the js goes.

> [bot](#comment_182_1KdnTJVBGzEZrJppFZtzfG9chukuMv8xSb): Basic use is zeronet.py --debug siteSign [address] [private key] which on Windows i save as a .bat text file and then 'run' in the main zeronet folder which has data folder containing all zites. The confusion starts with each zite having a data folder of their own for user files. So you as you move up and down your file tree it's easy to mistake one for the other.
> It's somewhat worse in Fuzium atm as python is wrapped in, so sometimes uses data folder within core. Until i figure it out i make data folders on a few levels and let it decide which one it wants to use.
> The main tutorial is on ZeroBlog..
> http://localhost:43110/Blog.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post:99:ZeroChat+tutorial+new

Great! I will walk through this and see if I can get it started. If I were to create some documentation / how-tos, where would I put that? For example, I could create some markdown files in a repository (maybe in ZeroTalk, though ZeroNet would be better)...

> [bot](#comment_182_1KdnTJVBGzEZrJppFZtzfG9chukuMv8xSb): Basic use is zeronet.py --debug siteSign [address] [private key] which on Windows i save as a .bat text file and then 'run' in the main zeronet folder which has data folder containing all zites. The confusion starts with each zite having a data folder of their own for user files. So you as you move up and down your file tree it's easy to mistake one for the other.
> It's somewhat worse in Fuzium atm as python is wrapped in, so sometimes uses data folder within core. Until i figure it out i make data folders on a few levels and let it decide which one it wants to use.
> The main tutorial is on ZeroBlog..
> http://localhost:43110/Blog.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post:99:ZeroChat+tutorial+new

How do you know what to use for the private key? `data/key-rsa.pem` didn't work:
I ran this:

```
./zeronet.py --debug siteSign 1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT data/key-rsa.pem 
```

And it didn't work. In the output was this line, I noticed:

```
Site:1TaLkF..jipT Private key invalid! Valid signers: ['1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT'], Private key address: False
```

Nothing in the `--help` output indicated how to pass in the private key (no examples a far as I can tell)...

> [kaffie](#comment_270_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): ZeroNet requires a log in for interaction. That's simply how it works. You can't post something without associating it to a public key. I'm at a loss for how you'd do this without it. There's no 'true' anonymity on ZN. Just pseudo-anonymity. And yeah, the site is very new. Not really anything posted but I personally visit there often, so if something pops up I'll likely contribute. if you were looking for something active, you're shit outta luck. The only active things on ZN are ZeroTalk and ZeroMe. Everything else is pretty dead.

I will contribute to that, then, as well.

It seems ZeroNet Central doesn't quite work. I get an error when I login (NonType is not Iterable or some such nonsense), got a 404 when I went to click the add thread link (not the button, but the link in the contentwell), and via the button after writing my thread it hung on creating the thread. Voting doesn't work for me either (though it shows me as signed in, despite the login error). Looks like it could use some help - you have this mess in a repository?

3_16UbJDyboDaAjW5fiZouKWpPJztpt43kEj.body:

Yeah, there already is a Chinese language zite, linked from the top menu. Don't you see? - 

>  Forums: Main · Dansk · Español · Français · German · Hungarian · Italian · Polish · Português · Québec · Russian · Ukrainian · 中文论坛

1_1NmT7R64j1uMJ9qs3Bfgda5cGczFqNmCBL.body:
> [user003](#comment_1_1Bte1EMmKsRq3aCPtKQNh3NLuhuXL8VVv): depends on what you want to do.

Yeah, while javascript is probably the biggest language right now (and very pertinent to web), I would suggest also learning a scripting language like python and a backend language like Java.

3_19nc7Xt7Bdjfgx89BwVeWM45fKwEkDk1iG.body:
> [rythyrix](#comment_58_18eGWSaM3Vc9i61LVfogjQJf5gp7EN7b9Y): Are you directly editing your data/users/<key>/data.json ? Because that is pretty cool. EDIT: This edit was made directly editing data/users/<key>/data.json.

nice!
